name: Bread Machine Pizza
instructions: Preheat your oven to 220C.
Add your flour, salt, water, yeast, white sugar and 2/3s of the oil to your bread machine and cook for 90 mins on a dough setting.

Meanwhile, heat the oil in a saucepan over a low heat, then add the onion along with a generous pinch of salt. Fry gently for 12-15 mins or until the onion has softened and is turning translucent. Add the garlic and fry for a further min.

Tip in the tomatoes and pur√©e along with the oregano and brown sugar. Bring to the boil and lower the heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 30-35 mins or until thickened and reduced. Season with salt and pepper and your finely chopped basil.
Roll your dough out thinly and cover with your sauce. Add your toppings and cook for 8-10 mins until the crust is firm.
notes: For a really smooth sauce, blitz with a stick blender, otherwise leave as is.

name: Bean and Halloumi Taco
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180C
Chop the halloumi and garlic, zest and halve the lime and mash the beans in a bowl
Add the garlic and tomato puree to a saucepan with a drizzle of oil and cook on a medium-high heat for a minute, then add the water and beans and cook for another 5 mins
Add half the chipotle paste, season with salt and pepper and simmer for 2-3 mins until thickened
Fry the halloumi in a pan on high heat with some oil until golden and pop the taco tortillas in the oven
Mix the chipotle paste, mayo and lime zest in a bowl and set aside to serve with the main course, along with the lettuce (thinly chopped)
Take the tortillas out of the oven and assemble the tacos with a dollop of spicy mayo, some lettuce, some bean mix and chunks of halloumi - enjoy!

name: Firecracker Beans
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350C.
Chop the bacon and fry in a pan until crisp, then remove and put to one side.
Chop the onion and garlic and fry in the same pan until soft.
Add the bourbon and cook until the liquid has nearly evaporated.
Stir in the beans, tomatoes, sugar, sauces and bacon and make sure everything is well mixed.
Transfer the beans to a dish and bake for 30 mins until bubbling.
notes: Add more tabasco for extra spice!

name: Baked Bacon Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Preheat your oven to 200C.
Chop the onion, garlic, mushrooms, parsley, lemon and bacon.
Fry the onion, garlic and bacon in a pan until soft, then add the mushrooms.

Stir in the risotto rice then add the cider vinegar, allowing it to evaporate completely before adding the stock. Stir and bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan with a lid (or seal it with foil). Pop on the middle shelf of your oven and bake until the rice is tender, 20-25 mins.

Take the lid off the risotto and stir in a knob of butter (if you have any) and three-quarters of the hard Italian cheese. Add a little lemon juice and stir in the parsley. Taste to make sure you are happy with the seasoning - add more salt, pepper or more lemon if necessary.
Serve with some rocket, the extra cheese and parsley.
notes: Be careful not to touch the pan when it's out of the oven - too hot!

name: Seafood Paella
instructions: Heat the oil in a big pan and add the onion, fry until browned.
Stir in the rice and cook for 30 secs to toast. Add the garlic, paprika, cayenne (if using) and saffron, cook for another 30 secs, then stir in the tomatoes and 1.5 litres of the stock.
Bring to the boil, then turn down to a simmer and cook, stirring, for about 10 mins (the rice should still be al dente).

Add the prawns, mussels and peas and then cover the pan with a large baking tray, or foil, and cook on a low heat for another 10-15 mins until the mussels are open and the prawns are cooked through. Scatter over the parsley before serving.
notes: Goes well with a simple salad and some garlic bread

name: Cauliflower Nuggets With A Bean Stew
instructions: Preheat your oven to 200C.

Pop the cauliflower florets into a mixing bowl. Season with salt and pepper and stir in the mayonnaise. Make sure the florets are well coated. In another small bowl, mix the panko breadcrumbs with half the spices. Season the crumbs with salt and stir in a glug of oil. Tip the crumbs onto the florets and toss to coat evenly.
Carefully transfer the florets to a lined baking tray and roast on the top shelf of your oven until golden and crispy, 20-25 mins.
Chop the courgette, garlic, chilli and coriander.

Heat a splash of oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the courgette and cook, stirring for 3 mins. Stir in the garlic and remaining spice mix, cook for 1 minute more, then add the finely chopped tomatoes and water. Bring to a simmer and add the beans after 5 mins. Cook until the stew is nice and thick.
When the cauliflower is ready, remove from the oven. Stir half the coriander into the stew, then remove from the heat. Season the stew with salt and as much red chilli as you like!
Spoon the spicy bean stew into bowls and add a dollop of sour cream. Arrange the cauliflower nuggets on top and finish with a sprinkling of remaining coriander.
notes: Crush half of the beans before adding them to the stew to improve the texture
